title: Isolate the Quadratic Term
text: We subtract $$6$$ on both sides to get $$r^2$$ by itself which gives $$3r^2=64$$.
speech: We subtract  6  on both sides to get  r squared  by itself which gives  3 r squared is equal to 64 .

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $$r^2=\frac{64}{3}$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives , r squared is equal to 64 over 3 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $$r^2=\frac{64}{3}$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$r=\sqrt{\frac{64}{3}}$$ or $$r=-\sqrt{\frac{64}{3}}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$3r^2+6=70$$ has two solutions which are $$r=-8\sqrt{\frac{1}{3}}$$, and $$r=8\sqrt{\frac{1}{3}}$$.
speech: Therefore,  3 r squared, plus 6 is equal to 70  has two solutions which are  r, is equal to negative 8, the square root of 1 third end root , and  r is equal to, 8, the square root of 1 third end root .
